resources.string: Enable TDD based sensitivity ratio for basal and glucose target modification

Uses the last 24h TDD/7D TDD to calculate sensitivity ratio used for increasing or decreasing basal rate, and also adjust glucose target if these options are enabled, in the same way Autosens does. It is recommended to start with this option turned off
Adjustment factor for DynamicISF. Set more than 100% for more aggressive correction doses, and less than 100% for less aggressive corrections.
How frequently SMBs will be given in min
When resistance is detected, lower the target glucose
When sensitivity is detected, raise the target glucose
Most recent algorithm for advanced users
Most recent algorithm for advanced users with dynamic/automatic ISF
Most recent algorithm for advanced users with AutoISF extensions
Max U/h a Temp Basal can be set to
This value is called max basal in OpenAPS context
Maximum basal IOB OpenAPS can deliver [U]
This value is called Max IOB in OpenAPS context\nThis is maximal insulin in [U] APS can deliver at once.
Default value: true\nThis is used to allow autosens to adjust BG targets, in addition to ISF and basals.

Default value: 3.0 (AMA) or 8.0 (SMB). This is a setting for default carb absorption impact per 5 minutes. The default is an expected 3mg/dl/5min. This affects how fast COB are decayed, and how much carb absorption is assumed in calculating future predicted BG, when BG is falling more than expected, or not rising as much as expected.

Default value: 3 This is a key OpenAPS safety cap. What this does is limit your basals to be 3x (in this people) your biggest basal rate. You likely will not need to change this, but you should be aware that’s what is discussed about “3x max daily; 4x current” for safety caps.

Default value: 4 This is the other half of the key OpenAPS safety caps, and the other half of “3x max daily; 4x current” of the safety caps. This means your basal, regardless of max basal set on your pump, cannot be any higher than this number times the current level of your basal. This is to prevent people from getting into dangerous territory by setting excessively high max basals before understanding how the algorithm works. Again, the default is 4x; most people will never need to adjust this and are instead more likely to need to adjust other settings if they feel like they are “running into” this safety cap.

Default value: 2\nBolus snooze is enacted after you do a meal bolus, so the loop won’t counteract with low temps when you’ve just eaten. The example here and default is 2; so a 3 hour DIA means that bolus snooze will be gradually phased out over 1.5 hours (3DIA/2).
Attention!\nNormally you do not have to change these values below. Please CLICK HERE and READ the text and make sure you UNDERSTAND it before change any of these values.
Always use short average delta instead of simple delta
Useful when data from unfiltered sources like xDrip+ gets noisy.
Maximum total IOB OpenAPS can\'t go over [U]
This value is called Max IOB in OpenAPS context\nOpenAPS will not add more insulin if current IOB is greater than this value
Use Super Micro Boluses instead of temp basal for faster action
Enable SMB always independently to COB, temp targets or boluses. Possible only with BG sources with advanced filtering of data
Enable SMB for 6h after carbs, even with 0 COB. Possible only with BG sources with advanced filtering of data
Enable SMB when there is COB active.
Enable SMB when there is temp target active (eating soon, exercise)
Enable SMB with high temp targets
Enable SMB when there is high temp target active (exercise, above 100 mg/dl or 5.5 mmol/l)
Max minutes of basal to limit SMB to
Max minutes of basal to limit SMB to for UAM
Minimum grams of carbs to display a carbs suggestion alert. Carbs suggestions below this number will not trigger a notification.

BG value below which insulin is suspended. Default value uses standard target model. User can set value between 60mg/dl (3.3mmol/l) and 100mg/dl(5.5mmol/l). Values below 65/3.6 result in use of default model
BG level below which low glucose suspend occurs
Increasing max basal value because setting is lower than your max basal in profile
Adjust algorithm to use dynamic sensitivity instead of profile value
Glucose watchdog to overrule the openAPSSMB algorithm within specified time slot if Tsunami mode is inactive.
Use fixed SMB cap instead of basal minutes as SMB size limiter.
max SMB size deliverable by wave mode.
Hour of the day from when on wave mode will be enabled.
Hour of the day until (and including) which wave mode is enabled.

Reduces the calculated insulin required to the specified percentage for delivery. Example: If calculated insulin required is 1 U and fraction size is 50%, at most 0.5 U will be delivered if no other constraints (e.g. SMB caps) apply.
Scales Wave SMB cap with the current profile percentage (max: 150%).
The following settings are for experienced users only and do not have to be adjusted! New users are advised to use the default settings.
Percentage of current IA to maintain in case of small delta values (constant activity mode for Wave).
Scales delta reduction with the current profile percentage (max: 150%).
Max minutes of basal to limit SMB to for Wave mode
EXPERIMENTAL: Use Autosens/dynISF adjusted sensitivity for Wave mode
Limiting IOB to %1$.1f U because of %2$s
A bolus was delivered within the last 3 minutes, skipping SMB
Activate or deactivate the implementation triggering the loop.
NO APS SELECTED OR PROVIDED RESULT
Open Loop will popup new change request only if change is bigger than this value in %. Default value is 20%
Fallback to SMB. Not enough TDD data.
Fallback to profile sensitivity. Not enough data. Reason: %1$s
Help for potential adjustments of profile (ISF, carb ratio, and basal rates)
If enabled, Autotune will automatically update and switch to input profile after calculation from an automation rule.
Enable only if you have reliably entered all carbs eaten, with this option sudden rises seen by Autotune will be used to recommend changes to the basal rate.
Enable only if you use free peak. This option will tune peak and DIA durations
Apply average result in circadian IC/ISF
Autotune will not tune circadian variations, this option only apply the average tuning of IC and ISF to your circadian input profile
Include more log information for debugging
Switch on only if requested by dev to send more log information to help debugging Autotune plugin
Default number of days of data to be processed by Autotune (up to 30)
Selected profile has %1$d IC values. Autotune will use %2$.2f g/U
Selected profile has %1$d ISF values. Autotune will use %2$.1f %3$s/U
Error in input data, try to run again autotune or reduce the number of days
Error in input data, increase the number of days
Autotune calculation started, please be patient
Check the results carefully before using it!
Create a new local profile from this Autotune Profile?
Set to a number, e.g. 160, which means when temp target is 160 mg/dL and High temptarget raises sensitivity=true, run 50%% basal at this level (120 = 75%%; 140 = 60%%).
AutoISF allows to adapt the insulin sensitivity factor (ISF) in various scenarios of glucose behaviour\n\nIt can also adapt SMB delivery settings
Set of options to increase the actual SMB size which can be delivered in situations where ISF was strengthened, i.e. fairly low ISF figure.\n\nUSE WITH CAUTION
Enable ISF adaptation by glucose behaviour

Similar to autosens_max this defines how strong ISF can become.

The default value 1.0 effectively shuts off this effect.

WARNING: Be extremely careful when using values above 2.5
Similar to autosens_min this defines how weak ISF can become.\n\nThe default value 1.0 effectively shuts off this effect.

This is the weight applied during longer lasting, elevated glucose plateaus and which strengthens ISF thereby potentially increasing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose is below target and which weakens ISF thereby potentially reducing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose is above target and which strengthens ISF thereby potentially increasing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose is rising and which strengthens ISF thereby potentially increasing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose accelerates and which strengthens ISF thereby potentially increasing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
This is the weight applied while glucose decelerates and which weakens ISF thereby potentially reducing insulin delivery.\n\nThe default value 0.0 effectively shuts off this effect.
variable SMB delivery ratio, lower end\n(smb_delivery_ratio_min)
variable SMB delivery ratio, upper end\n(smb_delivery_ratio_max)
variable SMB delivery ratio, mapped glucose range\n(smb_delivery_ratio_bg_range)

Default value: 0.5 This is another key OpenAPS safety cap, and specifies what share of the total insulin required can be delivered as SMB. This is to prevent people from getting into dangerous territory by setting SMB requests from the caregivers phone at the same time. Increase this experimental value slowly and with caution.
Default value: 0.5 This is the lower end of a linearly increasing ratio rather than the fix value above.
Default value: 0.5 This is the upper end of a linearly increasing ratio rather than the fix value above.

Default value: 0. The linearly increasing SMB delivery ratio is mapped to the glucose range [target_bg, target_bg+bg_range].\nAt target_bg the SMB ratio is smb_delivery_ratio_min, at target_bg+bg_range it is smb_delivery_ratio_max\nWith 0 the linearly increasing SMB ratio is disabled and the fixed smb_delivery_ratio is used.
Default value: 1 This is another key OpenAPS safety cap, and specifies by what factor you can exceed the regular 120 maxSMB/maxUAM minutes. Increase this experimental value slowly and with caution.
Enable alternative activation of SMB depending on active target being even number

enabled ...
if active target(mmol/L) has even decimal
or active target(mg/dL) is even number

disabled otherwise
Percentage of maxIOB above which SMBs are disabled.\nDefault value: 100%\nWith 100% this feature is effectively disabled.
!! Klik om te openen !!\n Inleiding \n Dit document geeft de basisuitleg over het AUTO-SMB algortime
!! Klik om te openen !!\n Document2 info
!! Klik om te openen !!\n Document3 info

● Algemene Info 
 
 ● ------- 

 !! Klik om te openen !!

● Activiteits instellingen gebasserd op stappen!:
 1. Stappenteller aan/uit schakelen.
 2. Insuline percentage bij gedetecteerde activiteit.
 
 !! Klik om te openen !!

● UAM Boost instellingen!:
 1. ∆15 groter dan drempelwaarde geeft boostpercentage op de insuline.
 2. Het basis boost percentage wordt toegepast en gecorrigeerd voor de Bg en de ∆15.
 
 !! Klik om te openen !!

● SMB versterker instellingen!:
 1. Percentage van de versterking (100% - 250%).
 2. Wachttijd voordat de versterker weer inwerking treedt na een vorige activering.
 
 !! Klik om te openen !!

● Basaal instellingen!:
 1. Percentage basaal tov TDD.
 2. Aanvullende gevoeligheids detectie op basis van tijdstip op de dag.
 
 !! Klik om te openen !!

● Extra resistentie instellingen!:
 1. Aanvullende gevoeligheids detectie op basis van tijdstip op de dag.
 
 !! Klik om te openen !!

Info tbv bolus-boost aanpassingen!
 1. Het ingestelde Boost-% wordt dynamisch t.o.v. loopttijd gecorrigeerd tussen +/- de ingestelde sterkte in procenten.
 2. Looptijd correctie (-15 tot +15 minuten), waar percentage gelijk aan ingestelde %.
 
 !! Klik om te openen !!

Info tbv Automatisering Note-boost aanpassingen!
 1. Via automatisering en gebruikers actie wordt een mode gekozen. 
 2. Laag, Middel, Hoog koolhydraat of Stop. Het ingestelde Boost-% wordt tijdens de loopttijd toegepast.
 3. Tevens wordt aan de start een extra SMB gegeven.
 
 !! Klik om te openen !!

Algemene instellingen!
 1. Tijdstip warop de dagstart en eindigt. 
 2. .......
 3. ..........
 
 !! Klik om te openen !!

﴿. Persistente Bg: 
 1. Drempelwaarde dag/nacht (mmol/l) 
 ● Waarde waaronder geen persistent hoge Bg wordt gedecteerd. 
 2. Maximum percentage dag/nacht. (%) 
 3. Range (mmol/l) 
 ● Range (+/- in mmol/l) waarbinnen de Bg als stabiel wordt beschouwd.
 

 !! Klik om te openen !!
De minimum waarde van de resistentie (10% - 100%).
De maximum waarde van de resistentie (100% - 200%).
Het effect van de resistentie sterkte kan worden gecorrigeerd tussen 10% en 200%.
Het effect van de resistentie sterkte kan worden gecorrigeerd tussen 10% en 200%.
Bg target overdag ten opzichte waarvan de afwijking tbv de resistentie wordt berekend
Bg target snachts ten opzichte waarvan de afwijking tbv de resistentie wordt berekend
Het aantal dagen dat de resistentie correctie terug kijkt om in de berekening (min 1, max 7).
Het aantal uren per dag waarover de bg wordt gemiddeld (min 1, max 5).
Bij activering boven de drempel wordt de insuline afgifte gecorrigeerd
Indien ingeschakeld worden de stappen uit het horloge gebruikt
Insuline percentage bij overschrijding van de stappendrempel
Stappen benodigd in 5 minuten om te activeren. De 30 en 60 minuten drempel wordt berekend t.o.v. deze waarde.
Maximum aantal keren dat de stappen acitvatie na-ijlt.
Dagen waarop het weekend algoritme actief is (opmaak vr,za,zo,ma,di,wo,do)
Tijdstip waarop het algoritme overschakelt naar de ochtend instellingen (opmaak hh:mm)
Tijdstip waarop het algoritme overschakelt naar de ochtend instellingen (opmaak hh:mm)
Tijdstip waarop het algoritme overschakelt naar de nacht instellingen (opmaak hh:mm)
Bij activering wordt boven de drempel waarde de insuline afgifte naar boven gecorrigeerd
Drempel bg-waarde waarboven de extra correctie overdag wordt toegepast
Drempel bg-waarde waarboven de extra correctie snachts wordt toegepast
Range in mmol waarbinnen de delta moet blijven voor de persistent hoge bg correctie
Maximum correctie percentage voor een persistente Bg overdag
Maximum correctie percentage voor een persistente Bg snachts
Time (week days) from when wave mode will be enabled.
Time (weekend) from when wave mode will be enabled.
Time until which wave mode is enabled.
Bij activering wordt boven de drempel waarde de insuline afgifte naar boven gecorrigeerd
Het start percentage wat nog wordt gecorrigeerd voor delta, IOB en Bg
Het maximum percentage wat bereikt kan worden
Drempel bg-waarde waarboven de extra correctie snachts wordt toegepast
minimum wachttijd na een boost voordat een nieuwe wordt geactiveerd
